title: UI: fullscreen mode and collapsed file monitor
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

UI improvements for file monitoring:

1. Always start in fullscreen mode by default (map takes all space)
2. Collapse the file monitoring section after file is selected - only show 'Stop' button
3. Add a minimal status bar at the very top of the screen showing:
   - File path
   - Last update time
   - All in a single line
4. Map should take all available space

Key files:
- frontend/src/components/editor/FileMonitor.tsx - collapse after selection
- frontend/src/components/MapEnvironment.tsx - fullscreen default, top status bar

Local commit only.

title: Remember last monitored file across refreshes
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Persist the last monitored file so it loads automatically on page refresh.

Options to explore:
1. File System Access API can persist FileSystemFileHandle via IndexedDB (best option if supported)
2. Store file path in localStorage/cookies as fallback hint

Implementation:
- When file is selected, persist the handle (IndexedDB) or path (localStorage)
- On page load, check for persisted handle/path
- If found, request permission and resume monitoring
- Handle permission denied gracefully (show file picker)

Key files:
- frontend/src/hooks/useFileMonitor.ts - add persistence logic
- May need to request permission again on reload (File System Access API requirement)

Local commit only.

title: Add Save to File button for writing map changes back
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Add a button to write the current map text back to the monitored file.

Implementation:
1. Add 'Save' button next to 'Stop' in the status bar (only visible when monitoring)
2. Use FileSystemFileHandle.createWritable() to write current mapText back to file
3. Temporarily pause file monitoring during write to avoid triggering a reload
4. Show brief feedback (e.g., 'Saved' indicator)

Key files:
- frontend/src/hooks/useFileMonitor.ts - add saveToFile action
- frontend/src/components/MapEnvironment.tsx - add Save button, pass mapText to save function

The FileSystemFileHandle is already stored - just need to use it for writing.

Local commit only.
